Table of Contents
Codes RFINK and RAFRQ
) This IRM section provides the instructions for the use of Reporting Agents (RAF) Inquiry command codes RFINK and RAFRQ. and (
) Purpose: These sections provide instructions for inputting information to research the RAF database (
) Audience: IRS Tax Technicians and Account Management employees. (
) Policy Owners: The Director, W&I owns the polices contained herein. (
) Program Owners: Wage & Investment (W&I) is responsible for the tion, procedures, and updates related to the program. (

) Primary Stakeholders: Wage & Investment (W&I), Large Business and national (LB&I), Small Business Self-Employed (SB&SE), Tax exempt and Government Entities (TE&GE), and Enterprise Operations (EOPS) (
) Program Goals: These are the instructions for using the RAF Inquiry IDRS command codes. (

) Reporting Agents File (RAF) is a computerized system of records which houses both the Reporting Agent Records and the Taxpayer/Client Records. Reporting Agents (RA) are authorized by their clients (BMF taxpayers) via Form
to electronically deposit employment taxes and e-ﬁle tax returns their behalf, as well as exchange other information with IRS on their behalf. (
) Form

, referred to as the “Reporting Agent Authorization”, is what the relationship between the business and the third party. By signing this the business taxpayer authorizes a reporting agent to sign and ﬁle speciﬁc business return forms as well as make federal tax deposits (FTDs) and tax payments (FTPs) on behalf of the business. (
) Only Reporting Agents have authorization authority to sign and ﬁle Federal Employment Tax Returns. (

) The RAF database also contains: • Taxpayer Information • Reporting Agent Information • Reporting Agent Authorizations • Authorization Agreements • Notice Indicator • Source Document Locator Number (SDLN) • MFT and Tax Period (
) Users of the RAF command codes are responsible for the information the RAF database. Certain actions may cause unpostable conditions that need corrective actions taken. (

) Command Code Deﬁnitions RFINK and RFINKR are IDRS command used to query the contents of the RAF database. To research information about a Business Taxpayer use CC RFINK. To research information about a Reporting Agent use CC RFINKR. RFINK and RFINKR, along with their various formats, are entered to access several different screen displays of data. Internal Revenue Manual
Codes RFINK and RAFRQ 2.3.16
This IRM section provides the instructions for the use of Reporting Agents File (RAF) Inquiry command codes RFINK and RAFRQ.

Command Code Deﬁnitions RFINK and RFINKR are IDRS command used to query the contents of the RAF database. To research information about a Business Taxpayer use CC RFINK. To research information about a Reporting Agent use CC RFINKR. RFINK and RFINKR, along with their various formats, are entered to access several different screen displays of data.

Deﬁned Terms or Acronyms Word or acronym: Meaning Example of use AFADT Input Command Add the EIN name Code Screen and address of the ﬁler onto RAF database AFUPT Input Command Change Reporting Code Screen Agent information and add comments BMF Business Master File The BMF dtat can be accessed online cc/CC Command Code Use to speed up pro- cessing time when entering data onto RAF DB2 The type of database The RAF database is RAF exits on IBM DB2 one EIN Employer Identiﬁca- The business tion Number Taxpayer identiﬁer is called an EIN EPMF Employee Plan EPMF contains Master File various employer plans used for their employees EXT Extension number The telephone used with a number was 123-45- telephone number 6789 with an ext of 123 ID Identiﬁcation An SSN and EIN are identiﬁcation numbers IDRS Integration Data IDRS only contains Retrieval System accounts being worked on not all the accounts being maintain by IRS MFT Master File Tax code The taxpayer used Form 1040 which is MFT-30 MF TRANS Master File Transac- By entering an Autho- tion rization on the database often cause a MF transaction being sent to the IDRS Master File
Deﬁned Terms or Acronyms

N/C Name Control The name control is usually the ﬁrst 4 characters of the Tax- payer’s BMF name NAP National Account We check the NAP for Proﬁle every Taxpayer. RAF Reporting Agent File The database that stores the Reporting Agent tax returns RAL Reporting Agent List Accompanying Forms 8655 RFINK Research Command Use to search RAF Code database for Reporting Agent Au- thorization RFINKR Research Command Use to search RAF Code database for Reporting Agents. RFRMA Command Code Use to input screen Reporting Agent Au- thorization onto RAF database RFRMAT Command Code Used to retrieve and screen change Reporting Agent information RFRTM Command Code Used to retrieve and screen change Authorization on RAF database RFRTMT Command Code Used to retrieve and screen change Taxpayer in- formation on RAF database TC Transaction Code 960 and 961 Code that is use to send Transactions to Master File UPC Unpostable code 960 Transaction code that send a un- postable transaction.

) The Reporting Agents File contains information regarding the type of tion that taxpayers have given to their reporting agent for the employment tax modules and/or the payment modules in their account. This authorization allows the reporting agent to ﬁle certain forms for the taxpayer on magnetic tape or electronically or make magnetic tape or electronic submission of

federal tax deposits. The information from the authorization is used to direct copies of notices and correspondence to reporting agents when this has been authorized. It can also be used to determine whether an individual claiming to be a reporting agent for a taxpayer is, in fact, authorized to receive the infor- mation he/she requests. CC RFINK is the only command code needed to

the RAF. command code is used to research the RAF. Different information will be based on the input. a. When CC RFINK is input with a Taxpayer EIN only, a list of MFT’s and beginning tax periods present for the taxpayer will be displayed along with reporting agent’s name, EIN and authorization information. Authori- zation remains valid until terminated by the Taxpayer or Reporting b. When CC RFINK is input with the Taxpayer EIN and module information (MFT code, form deﬁner, payment type, and tax period), all information for that module will be displayed if it is present on the RAF. c. When CC RFINK is input with Taxpayer EIN, module information, and Reporting Agent EIN, all speciﬁc information for that module will be displayed if the reporting agent has an authorization for that module. d. When CC RFINK is input with the deﬁner “R” and reporting agents EIN, speciﬁc information about that reporting agent (name, address, and telephone number) will be displayed. e. When CC RFINK is input with the Taxpayer EIN, information for that taxpayer will be displayed if it is present. RFINK can then be entered the deﬁner “L,” taxpayers EIN, and reporting agent’s EIN, to display mation about that taxpayer with that reporting agent. f. If one or more of the input ﬁelds is invalid, messages will be displayed which will indicate which ﬁelds were invalid. g. When CC RFINK is input with Taxpayer EIN and the deﬁner “ L,”a year can be viewed which shows the beginning year a Reporting Agent has authorization to exchange information pertaining to a Taxpayer’s Form W
and Form

h. If the taxpayer data on RAF needs to be associated with the add/delete listing created from the reporting agent tape, the reel number can be used to locate the listing associated with that tape. The reel number appears on the add/delete listing and on the IDRS terminal screen. It displays whenever CC RFINK is input with a taxpayer EIN only. A numeric value will appear in this ﬁeld only when the taxpayer is added tape. Otherwise, the reel number ﬁeld will be blank or zeroes. i. If Form

, Reporting Agent Authorizations, is requested from the RAF Unit at the Ogden campus, the reporting agent name and receipt date should be used to request it. All Reporting Agent Authorizations will be ﬁled by the reporting agent’s name and receipt date. j. See IRM
for a complete description of command codes used for RAF updates: RFRTM, RFADD, RFUPT, RFRMA, AFADT, AFUPT, Messages are displayed on line
Codes RFINK and RAFRQ 2.3.16
b. NO DATA AVAILABLE — This indicates that there is no Taxpayer or Reporting Agent on the RAF ﬁle which matches the number input on screen. c. N/R OF T/P ACCOUNT
RA ON RAF — The Reporting Agent is present on the ﬁles, but, the Taxpayer is not. d. N/R OF T/P MOD
T/P AND RA ON RAF — The Taxpayer and Agent are on ﬁle, but not with the module you have requested. e. N/R OF T/P MOD
T/P ON RAF
N/R RA — The Taxpayer is on ﬁle, but not with the module you have requested. f. N/R OF TAXPAYER MODULE
T/P ON RAF — The Taxpayer exists, but not with that module. g. FILE ERROR — An unidentiﬁed error occurred in attempting to access the data base. This maybe a system error, re
enter. If problem recurs, notify DCC CAF/RAF Section. h. NO RECORD OF T/P ACCOUNT — The taxpayer does not currently exist on RAF ﬁles. i. TAX MOD HAS DIFF RA
RA ENTERED ON RAF — The Reporting entered has no authorization for this MFT/TAX PERIOD, but he/she is present on RAF. j. TAX MOD HAS DIFF RA

N/R RA ENTERED — The Reporting Agent entered has no authorization for this MFT/TAX PERIOD and he/she is not currently on RAF. k. N/R OF T/P WITH THIS AGENT — The taxpayer does not currently exist on the RAF ﬁles with this agent. l. BEG/END QUARTER NOT VALID — The beginning or ending quarter not valid as entered. m. BEG/END QUARTER NOT PRESENT — Both the beginning and quarter must be entered for this request. n. BEG/END QTR NOT VALID FOR TP/RA — The taxpayer does not currently exist on the RAF ﬁles with this agent for the requested
) CC RFINK is a prerequisite for CC RFRTM which requests the formats of RAF update command codes RFADD and RFUPT. (
) CC RFINK input with the taxpayer EIN only may be followed by CC RFRTM, provided a record for the taxpayer is found on the RAF. This will bring up RFUPT format. (

) CC RFINK input with the taxpayer EIN, module information, and reporting agent information may be followed by CC RFRTM. This will bring up the priate RFADD format based on the response to the RFINK input. (
) CC RFINK is a prerequisite for CC RFRMA which requests the formats of RAF update command codes AFADT, AFUPT, and RFMRG. (
) CC RFINK input with the reporting agent EIN may be followed by CC provided a record for the reporting agent is found on the RAF. This will bring up the AFUPT format. (
) CC RFINK input with the reporting agent EIN may be followed by CC This will bring up the AFADT format based on the response to the RFINK input.
CC RFINK is a prerequisite for CC RFRTM which requests the formats of RAF update command codes RFADD and RFUPT.
(01-01-2006) Subsequent Command Code Usage — CC RFINK
CC RFINK is a prerequisite for CC RFRMA which requests the formats of the RAF update command codes AFADT, AFUPT, and RFMRG.
) CC RFINK input with the reporting agent EIN followed by CC RFRMA and proper deﬁner will bring up the RFMRG format. (

) This command code is used to generate a list of all current Taxpayer authori- zations that have been granted to a speciﬁc Reporting Agent. Formerly as the “Compare” report, this report is generated at the request of the Reporting Agent so that they can “Compare” our record of current Taxpayer authorizations against theirs and send in any add or delete actions that may necessary. a. When CC RAFRQ is input with no Deﬁner and a speciﬁc Reporting EIN, that EIN is stored in a list of EIN’s that are waiting to be processed by a nightly batch run that will create the requested report. b. When CC RAFRQ is input with Deﬁner P, the User will see the list of EINs that are currently “Pending” processing. c. The requested reports will be prepared and ready for the User by the start of the next business day. They can receive them via CTRL-D. (
) Error Messages are displayed on line

These messages result in no being fulﬁlled by the batch run: a. THIS REQUEST ALREADY EXISTS — The EIN entered has already been requested and is pending the processing step. Correct and b. THIS REPORTING AGENT EIN DOES NOT EXIST ON THE — The EIN entered does not match any Reporting Agents on ﬁle. and re-enter.

When CC RAFRQ is input with no Deﬁner and a speciﬁc Reporting EIN, that EIN is stored in a list of EIN’s that are waiting to be by a nightly batch run that will create the requested report. When CC RAFRQ is input with Deﬁner P, the User will see the list of EINs that are currently “Pending” processing. The requested reports will be prepared and ready for the User by the start of the next business day. They can receive them via CTRL
D.

enter.
